boat.name: Morwenna
boat.full_description:
'Morwenna' is a beautiful Cornish Crabber 22’. Built in 1997 she is a GRP gaff-rigged cutter designed by Roger Dongray.

When originally built, and called 'Salem', she was exported to the USA and shipped back to the UK by the second owners in 2011 since when she has cruised the West Country.

She was sold in 2016.
boat.short_description: 'Morwenna', then called 'Salem' was exported to the USA when built and shipped back to the UK for her second owners in 2011 since when she has cruised the West Country.

for_sales.sales_text:
"Morwenna" is a beautiful Cornish Crabber 22â€™ in excellent condition. Built in 1997 she is a GRP Gaff-rigged cutter designed by Roger Dongray. She is 22ft in length over deck plus a 5ft lifting bowsprit. Enterprise blue topsides. White roller jib, staysail and mainsail with two reefing points. She has a 9hp Yanmar diesel engine (professionally maintained) and a feathering prop. Two main berths plus a small V berth in the fore cabin. A sea toilet, sink and gas cooker. Depth sounder/log, Chart plotter and DSC/AIS VHF radio.

This lovely classic gaff-rigged coastal sailer is the ideally versatile family yacht and creek cruiser for weekending or longer. An as new twin-axle road trailer (late 2011) is included in the sale.

Lying ashore at Mylor, Cornwall.
